data_points.Description: Retrieve and analyze DNS records (A, AAAA, MX, NS, SOA, TXT, CNAME, PTR, SRV), including DNSSEC validation, reverse DNS lookup, PTR records, DNS over HTTPS support, DNS zone transfer vulnerability, and historical DNS records.
Obtain domain registrar details, registration date, expiry date, registrant contact details, domain age, and historical ownership data.

Fetch SSL/TLS certificate details, including validity dates, issuer, subject, SANs; analyze SSL/TLS configurations, supported protocols and versions, cipher suites, certificate chain, algorithm strength, revocation status; check for vulnerabilities, forward secrecy support, session resumption support, expiry monitoring, certificate pinning, and SSL Labs grade retrieval.
Determine the physical location (country, region, city), coordinates, ISP, and check IP reputation in spam and blacklist databases.

data_points.Info: Reverse IP Lookup and Shared Hosting Detection
data_points.Description: Find other domains hosted on the same IP address, virtual hosts, and determine if the website is on shared hosting.
Extract HTML content, meta tags, internal and external links, scripts, resources; detect deprecated HTML tags, doctype declaration, content freshness, and use of client hints.

Retrieve and analyze HTTP headers, including server type, content type, security headers (CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, X-Content-Type-Options), cache control headers, cookies, referrer policy, header fingerprinting, detect HTTP methods allowed, HTTP authentication methods, and potential header injection points.

Identify server-side technologies, CMS, e-commerce platforms, JavaScript frameworks, CSS libraries, backend programming language, language frameworks, application dependencies, third-party widgets, and code repositories linking.
Access site traffic data, analyze SEO practices (meta descriptions, keywords, header tags), Open Graph meta tags, microdata and schema.org usage, and perform link analysis.

Conduct open ports scanning, vulnerability assessment, SSL/TLS configuration checks, subdomain enumeration, test for vulnerabilities (XSS, CSRF, SSRF, SQL injection, remote file inclusion), analyze session management, error handling mechanisms, password policies, security headers, and WAF detection.
Determine the use of CDN services and details about the hosting provider, including CDN edge locations and third-party CDN resources.
Extract links to social media profiles associated with the website, detect third-party tracking and analytics services, third-party login services, and third-party widgets.
Find the number of pages indexed, retrieve robots.txt and sitemap.xml, list disallowed entries, perform sitemap enumeration, and check for sitemap discrepancies.
Access archive snapshots (e.g., via Wayback Machine), historical DNS records, and domain history.
Retrieve and analyze SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records, email server configurations, and check for email server vulnerabilities.

Check site uptime and availability, measure resource loading times, application performance metrics, load times for critical resources, response header timing analysis, and evaluate performance optimization techniques.
Perform keyword extraction, sentiment analysis, language detection, internationalization support, language tags, and localization settings.
List subdomains associated with the domain, including subdomains discovered via certificate transparency logs.
Find email addresses present on the website.
Retrieve and analyze cookies set by the website, session IDs, session management, entropy of session IDs, session fixation vulnerabilities, and client-side storage.
Detect WAF services protecting the site.
Detect public APIs and endpoints exposed by the website, check for API documentation availability, test API rate limits.
Analyze website for accessibility features, mobile responsiveness, use of media queries, service worker usage, PWA features, and browser compatibility.

data_points.Info: Exif Data and Metadata in Media Files
data_points.Description: Extract Exif metadata from images, metadata from documents (Word, Excel, PDFs), and perform reverse image search.
Determine if the site uses CAPTCHA mechanisms, identify anti-automation techniques like hidden fields or time-based tokens.
Detect the presence of load balancers, map infrastructure components like firewalls and databases, and determine if the application is containerized or uses IaC tools.
Find backup files or old versions of files that may be publicly accessible.
Identify the web server software and its version.
Determine the HTTP protocol versions supported by the server (e.g., HTTP/1.1, HTTP/2, HTTP/3), check for HTTP compression support, pipelining support, and HTTP methods allowed.
Identify and analyze file upload features for security testing.
Capture service banners for services running on open ports.
Look for database error messages that could reveal database structure or vulnerabilities.
Determine if the site complies with GDPR regarding cookies and data privacy.
Check if the site uses SRI for external scripts to ensure integrity.
Identify domains that are typos or misspellings of the target domain, which might be used for phishing.
Check if the domain is associated with malware or phishing activities.

data_points.Info: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and Containerization Detection
data_points.Description: Detect if the website uses IaC tools or is containerized using Docker or Kubernetes.
Search for accidental data leaks like API keys or credentials in the code.
Detect misconfigured cloud storage buckets that may be publicly accessible.
Detect if the website runs cryptocurrency mining scripts in the browser.
Identify if the website uses WebSockets or other real-time communication technologies.
Assess if the website uses client-side and server-side input validation.
Determine if the site uses 301, 302, meta refresh, or JavaScript-based redirections, analyze redirection chains and canonical URLs.
Detect the use of AJAX calls within the website.
Attempt to enumerate user accounts through error messages or predictable URLs.

data_points.Info: SSL/TLS Forward Secrecy and Session Resumption
data_points.Description: Check if the SSL/TLS configuration supports forward secrecy and session resumption mechanisms.
Identify if the website uses WebAssembly modules or other advanced web technologies.
Check if version control directories like .git or .svn are exposed.
Assess the security of the password reset process.
Detect the use of URL shorteners and expand them to original URLs.
Enumerate all IP addresses associated with the domain.
Identify embedded video and audio content and their sources.
Test if DNS servers allow zone transfers (AXFR).
Check for X-Frame-Options header to prevent clickjacking.
